channel.title: Comments on: Tweaking NHibernate Mappings at Runtime With a Remapper
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: We were using XML mappings in this case, but I would prefer not to maintain two sets of conventions either. If the differences were significant it would work, but I'm not sure how you'd get the platform info into the convention (I'm not aware how to get it until your configuration is built).
item.content:encoded: We were using XML mappings in this case, but I would prefer not to maintain two sets of conventions either. If the differences were significant it would work, but I’m not sure how you’d get the platform info into the convention (I’m not aware how to get it until your configuration is built).

item.title: By: David Kemp
item.dc:creator: David Kemp
item.description: Could you not use a difference set of conventions for if you're using Oracle or not?
item.content:encoded: Could you not use a difference set of conventions for if you’re using Oracle or not?
